title: Literary Analysis: Theme and Character Development

vocab.definition: The main message or lesson that a story teaches
How a character changes or grows throughout a story
The main problem or struggle in a story
How the conflict or problem is solved in a story
Who is telling the story (first person, third person)
The main character, often the one who faces the problem
A character or force that works against the protagonist
A quality that describes a character (like brave, kind)
A reason why a character acts or feels a certain way
The words characters say to each other
How an author shows what a character is like
Another way to say the story's lesson or theme
Words or details from the text that support your answer
Things that happen in the story; parts of the plot
What characters do that can show their traits and help reveal theme

teachingNotes: Help students identify themes in age-appropriate literature. Analyze how characters change from beginning to end of stories. Practice identifying different types of conflicts and their resolutions.

sample.question: What is the difference between a story's theme and its plot?
expectedAny: theme is the message; plot is events

sample.question: Give an example of a common theme.
What is character development?
expectedAny: how a character changes or grows

sample.question: What does point of view mean?
What clues help you find a theme?

truefalse.question: A theme is usually stated directly in the first paragraph of a story.
Characters can change because of events in the story.
The plot is the same as the theme.
Conflicts often help reveal the theme.
Resolutions show how problems are solved.
Point of view never affects how we understand a story.
Readers can infer the theme from the ending.

multiplechoice.question: Which of these is an example of character development?
Which detail supports a theme of friendship?
Which might reveal theme the most?

fillintheblank.question: The main problem that a character faces in a story is called the ________.
The lesson or message is the ________.
How the problem is solved is the ________.
A story's events are called the ________.
Who tells the story is the ________ of view.
A character who changes shows ________ development.
A struggle with outside forces is ________ conflict.

shortanswer.question: How can you identify the theme of a story?
expectedAny: what the author wants us to learn

shortanswer.question: Describe how a character changed in a story you read.
Give text evidence that supports a theme of kindness.
Explain the conflict and resolution in a favorite story.
expectedAny: problem and how it was solved
what went wrong and how it ended
who/what caused the problem and the solution

shortanswer.question: How can point of view affect what we learn?
expectedAny: knows more/less info depending on POV

shortanswer.question: State a theme and support it with two details.
How do character actions reveal theme?
expectedAny: actions show what lesson is learned
what they do shows the theme
